reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a great base of operations for our 2 and 1 night stays in Reykjavik (start and end of trip). We could walk to all the main sites in the city center, and there are tons of close restaurants, shops, and cafes. Tour companies and the airport flybus can pick you up here as well. Our front desk person arranged the flybus pickup for us.
reviews.title: Good Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in both a 'standard' and 'superior' room. Both times we asked to be in a quiet room away from the street. The rooms were relatively quiet, however things were definitely noisier on Friday than on Thursday or Tuesday nights.
reviews.title: Perfect
Lacks appreciation of customers
reviews.text: The standard room was small, with closet, desk, tiny bathroom, and two twin beds (a little hard) pushed together. Bedding was European Style (fitted sheet + duvet in cover) The superior room had one king bed, one twin bed, a closet, and a slightly larger bathroom. There were more windows and the room felt a little airier, but there still wasn't a lot of room if you wanted to walk past each other.

All rooms have a small minibar/fridge, and an electric tea kettle with instant coffee and tea. The hot water has a slight sulphur/iron smell, which is normal for Reykjavik (due to the geothermal heat source). The cold water does not smell and is great drinking water.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.text: There is free wireless internet on the ground floor only... so our standard room got reception and the superior room on the 5th floor did not. However, the wireless internet was broken for our last night. There is a computer in the lobby that guests can use for free.
reviews.title: Fantastic value, and the staff is excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great. We are close to everything but not on the busiest street, and therefore the noise level is better. We had great views of the ocean and the tops of the building, so request higher floors if you can. The room and bathroom are average, nothing special. There is a computer in the lobby for checking emails which was great. The breakfast buffet was good. The staff was not as knowledgeable or friendly as other hotel staffs in Iceland. Overall, it was okay
reviews.title: Good hotel. Not special. Well located

reviews.text: CenterHotel Klopp is within walking distance of anything and everything you would want to go to in Reykjavik. My family travelled by foot to almost everywhere we went! The front desk staff could have been more helpful: they weren't very friendly and didn't offer much assistance. The provided breakfast was adequate. The rooms are extra teeny, but quite clean! All-in-all, we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Klopp is a nice hotel but nothing fancy. Room was small by North American standards but not cramped. Furnishings were minimal and a little Ikea'ish. Location was good. Easy walking distance to 'downtown' Reyjkavik. Lots of restaurants, bars and shopping nearby. Staff were friendly and helpful. Complimentary continental breakfast was a bonus.
reviews.title: Nice hotel centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Centerhotel Klopp for 3 nights in June. They are conveniently located about a 10-minute walk from most sites (like the harbor, city pond and church) and only a block from the main shopping thorofare. The hotel is very clean and quiet with a mature clientele (no kids that we saw, anyway.)
reviews.title: Clean, convenient and helpful!

reviews.text: The room was an acceptable size for two people with a small bathroom, fridge, tv, desk and closet. The blackout curtains helped keep the midnight sun out of our eyes. An alarm clock (or any clock) would have been appreciated!
reviews.title: Right in town, clean, friendly staff, good value for money..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Klopp for seven nights and expected to stay in a tiny room the whole time. But we were pleasantly surprised to have a room on the top floor with a beautiful view of the water. And, since it was a corner room, it was bigger than the other units in the hotel.
reviews.title: Better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasn't a big fan of the open-floor shower in our bathroom. It seemed like I used most of our spare towels to keep the water from overflowing into the rest of the bathroom. The bottom of the shower curtain was also moldy because of the open-shower design.
reviews.title: Great central location with friendly staff

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were sort of aloof and stoic, but that seemed to be the customer service norm in Iceland. We forgot our electrical adaptor and asked the front desk if they had and extra one, which they did not. So we walked a couple blocks to Klopp's sister hotel and retrieved an adaptor there. I have no idea why the staff at Klopp didn't suggest that considering they ended up sending overflow customers to the same sister hotel during our stay. But the staff was helpful in booking tours for us and assisting us with other general information.
reviews.title: Hotel Klopp? Hotel Flopp!

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast offered a nice variety where you could have something different to eat 3 or 4 morning. There was one morning where some of the bread was stale.
reviews.title: Good Value for money

reviews.text: The location was superb and the one of the main reasons we chose Klopp (the price being the other). We weren't at our hotel much during our vacation so we were able to overlook some of the negatives. Our visit to Iceland was fantastic and we're glad we stayed at the Klopp.
reviews.title: Only Location was Good
Great for Nightlife and a Great Price
reviews.text: I pick a hotel for one main reason - how close it is to the bars and pubs! This hotel is as close as you can get to the main entertainment area of Reykjavik with plenty of watering holes within an easy 5 minute walk. The bus stop to/from the airport isn't too much farther away. Also, the main shopping street is a block away if you like that kind of thing. The room for me (a single male) was fine - a simple bed and a sparkling clean bath. Nothing too fancy, but nothing fancy means nothing to break when I finally stumble home. Eveything is clean and new, but definitely mdoest and understated. If you're looking for a big room with lots of furniture, fine dining, a massage, fancy pillows, a fancy lobby and so forth - don't stay here. If you want a clean reliable modern place to stay where you can party safely nearby and get home without a taxi - then stay here. Der Danske Kro ad Prikid are two great nearby bars if you like conversation and meeting people...
Having followed the recommendations of fellow trip-advisors, we booked 4 nights at the hotel through a hotel/flight deal. The cost of the hotel came down to approximately £15 pppn as a result.
reviews.title: Well located, clean and functional hotel

reviews.text: Reykjavik is extremely small when compared to most other European capitals, such that everywhere is easily navigable on foot. Staying in the hotel, which was 30 seconds away from the sea and a stunning view of mount Esja was a huge bonus. We were close to the church, museums and restaurants.
reviews.title: Fabulous place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room itself was perfectly nice, and had a TV with a random assortment of channels including BBC1 (Wales!). The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, and having the internet meant that we could update our status and make our friends at home increasingly jealous!
reviews.title: Great centrally located budget hotel in Reykjavik!!

reviews.text: This was a great place to stay. First the location is excellent, adjacent to the main shopping street and within 10-15 walk of the main harbour. The main shopping street is full of bars and great restaurants.
reviews.title: Clean, cozy, warm rooms!
